trans-unit.source: Use Hadoop Pig with Curl in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Hadoop Pig with Curl in HDInsight | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Curl to run Pig Latin jobs on a Hadoop cluster in Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Curl to run Pig Latin jobs on a Hadoop cluster in Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: In this document, you will learn how to use Curl to run Pig Latin jobs on an Azure HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: In this document, you will learn how to use Curl to run Pig Latin jobs on an Azure HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The Pig Latin programming language allows you to describe transformations that are applied to the input data to produce the desired output.
trans-unit.target: The Pig Latin programming language allows you to describe transformations that are applied to the input data to produce the desired output.

trans-unit.source: Curl is used to demonstrate how you can interact with HDInsight by using raw HTTP requests to run, monitor, and retrieve the results of Pig jobs.
trans-unit.target: Curl is used to demonstrate how you can interact with HDInsight by using raw HTTP requests to run, monitor, and retrieve the results of Pig jobs.

trans-unit.source: This works by using the WebHCat REST API (formerly known as Templeton) that is provided by your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This works by using the WebHCat REST API (formerly known as Templeton) that is provided by your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If you are already familiar with using Linux-based Hadoop servers, but are new to HDInsight, see <linkText>Linux-based HDInsight Tips</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are already familiar with using Linux-based Hadoop servers, but are new to HDInsight, see <linkText>Linux-based HDInsight Tips</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (Linux-based or Windows-based)
trans-unit.target: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (Linux-based or Windows-based)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Curl</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Curl</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>jq</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>jq</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: When using Curl or any other REST communication with WebHCat, you must authenticate the requests by providing the administrator user name and password for the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: When using Curl or any other REST communication with WebHCat, you must authenticate the requests by providing the administrator user name and password for the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You must also use the cluster name as part of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that is used to send the requests to the server.
trans-unit.target: You must also use the cluster name as part of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that is used to send the requests to the server.

trans-unit.source: For the commands in this section, replace USERNAME with the user to authenticate to the cluster, and replace PASSWORD with the password for the user account.
trans-unit.target: For the commands in this section, replace USERNAME with the user to authenticate to the cluster, and replace PASSWORD with the password for the user account.

trans-unit.source: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your cluster.

trans-unit.source: The REST API is secured via [basic access authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basicaccessauthentication).
trans-unit.target: The REST API is secured via [basic access authentication](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Basicaccessauthentication).

trans-unit.source: You should always make requests by using Secure HTTP (HTTPS) to help ensure that your credentials are securely sent to the server.
trans-unit.target: You should always make requests by using Secure HTTP (HTTPS) to help ensure that your credentials are securely sent to the server.

trans-unit.source: From a command line, use the following command to verify that you can connect to your HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: From a command line, use the following command to verify that you can connect to your HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: You should receive a response similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should receive a response similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The parameters used in this command are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The parameters used in this command are as follows:

trans-unit.source: -u: The user name and password used to authenticate the request
trans-unit.target: -u: The user name and password used to authenticate the request

trans-unit.source: -G: Indicates that this is a GET request
trans-unit.target: -G: Indicates that this is a GET request

trans-unit.source: The beginning of the URL, https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/templeton/v1, will be the same for all requests.
trans-unit.target: The beginning of the URL, https://CLUSTERNAME.azurehdinsight.net/templeton/v1, will be the same for all requests.

trans-unit.source: The path, /status, indicates that the request is to return the status of WebHCat (also known as Templeton) for the server.
trans-unit.target: The path, /status, indicates that the request is to return the status of WebHCat (also known as Templeton) for the server.

trans-unit.source: Use the following code to submit a Pig Latin job to the cluster:
trans-unit.target: Use the following code to submit a Pig Latin job to the cluster:

trans-unit.source: The parameters used in this command are as follows:
trans-unit.target: The parameters used in this command are as follows:

trans-unit.source: -d: Because -G is not used, the request defaults to the POST method.
trans-unit.target: -d: Because -G is not used, the request defaults to the POST method.

trans-unit.source: -d specifies the data values that are sent with the request.
trans-unit.target: -d specifies the data values that are sent with the request.

trans-unit.source: user.name: The user who is running the command
trans-unit.target: user.name: The user who is running the command

trans-unit.source: execute: The Pig Latin statements to execute
trans-unit.target: execute: The Pig Latin statements to execute

trans-unit.source: statusdir: The directory that the status for this job will be written to
trans-unit.target: statusdir: The directory that the status for this job will be written to

trans-unit.source: Notice that the spaces in Pig Latin statements are replaced by the + character when used with Curl.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the spaces in Pig Latin statements are replaced by the + character when used with Curl.

trans-unit.source: This command should return a job ID that can be used to check the status of the job, for example:
trans-unit.target: This command should return a job ID that can be used to check the status of the job, for example:

trans-unit.source: To check the status of the job, use the following command.
trans-unit.target: To check the status of the job, use the following command.

trans-unit.source: Replace JOBID with the value returned in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: Replace JOBID with the value returned in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the return value was {"id":"job_1415651640909_0026"}, then JOBID would be job_1415651640909_0026.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the return value was {"id":"job_1415651640909_0026"}, then JOBID would be job_1415651640909_0026.

trans-unit.source: If the job has finished, the state will be SUCCEEDED.
trans-unit.target: If the job has finished, the state will be SUCCEEDED.

trans-unit.source: This Curl request returns a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) document with information about the job, and jq is used to retrieve only the state value.
trans-unit.target: This Curl request returns a JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) document with information about the job, and jq is used to retrieve only the state value.

trans-unit.source: When the state of the job has changed to SUCCEEDED, you can retrieve the results of the job from Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: When the state of the job has changed to SUCCEEDED, you can retrieve the results of the job from Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The statusdir parameter passed with the query contains the location of the output file; in this case, wasb:///example/pigcurl.
trans-unit.target: The statusdir parameter passed with the query contains the location of the output file; in this case, wasb:///example/pigcurl.

trans-unit.source: This address stores the output of the job in the example/pigcurl directory in the default storage container used by your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This address stores the output of the job in the example/pigcurl directory in the default storage container used by your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You can list and download these files by using the <linkText>Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can list and download these files by using the <linkText>Azure CLI for Mac, Linux and Windows</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For example, to list files in example/pigcurl, use the following command:
trans-unit.target: For example, to list files in example/pigcurl, use the following command:

trans-unit.source: To download a file, use the following:
trans-unit.target: To download a file, use the following:

trans-unit.source: You must specify the storage account name that contains the blob by using the -a and -k parameters, or set the AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT and AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS\_KEY environment variables.
trans-unit.target: You must specify the storage account name that contains the blob by using the -a and -k parameters, or set the AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCOUNT and AZURE\_STORAGE\_ACCESS\_KEY environment variables.

trans-unit.source: As demonstrated in this document, you can use a raw HTTP request to run, monitor, and view the results of Pig jobs on your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: As demonstrated in this document, you can use a raw HTTP request to run, monitor, and view the results of Pig jobs on your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the REST interface used in this article, see the <linkText>WebHCat Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the REST interface used in this article, see the <linkText>WebHCat Reference</linkText><title></title>.
